exclusion:
Bring your Z-Wave gateway (hub) close to the relay if possible

Put the Z-Wave hub into exclusion mode (not sure how to do that? ask@getzooz.com)

Click the on the relay 3 times quickly (theZ-Wave button LED indicator will start blinking green)

Your hub will confirm exclusion, the LED indicator on the relay will turn green for 2 seconds, and the device will disappear from your controller's device list.
inclusion:
Initiate inclusion (pairing) in the app (or web interface).

Tap the Z-WAVE button 3 times quickly if using traditional Z-Wave inclusion.

The LED indicator will blink green to signal communication and turn green for 2 seconds if inclusion is successful or turn red for 2 seconds if the pairing attempt fails.
label: ZEN54
overview:
• Z-Wave 0-10 V dimming control for LED fixtures
  • Great for 0-10 V LED drivers in LED panels
  • Smooth dimming with instant status updates
  • Installs behind your existing wall switch (on/off or momentary)
  • 700 series Z-Wave chip for better range and faster control
  • Z-Wave Long Range for ultra reliable no-mesh communication
  • Advanced configuration including min and max brightness
  • Built-in Z-Wave signal repeater for boosted communication
  • SmartStart and S2 Security for a safer network
usage:
3 x tap: enter inclusion (pairing) or exclusion mode

2 x tap and hold (the third time) for 15 seconds: factory reset

parameters.label: On / Off Status After Power Failure
parameters.description: On / Off Status After Power Failure
parameters.overview:
0 – forced to OFF (regardless of state prior to power outage);

1-99 – forced to ON at the selected brightness level (regardless of state prior to power outage);

100 – remembers and restores on/off status or brightness level after power failure (default);

options.label: Forced to OFF (regardless of state prior to power outage);
forced to ON at the selected brightness level (regardless of state pri
remembers and restores on/off status or brightness level after power f

parameters.label: LED Indicator
parameters.description: Enable or disable the LED indicator.
parameters.overview:
0 – LED Indicator disabled;

1 – LED Indicator enabled (default)

parameters.label: Dimming Speed
parameters.description: Adjust the dimming speed (fade-in / fade-out) for your dimmer when the light is turned on and off from the switch or via Z-Wave. Values correspond to the number of seconds it take for the dimmer to reach full brightness or completely turn off.

parameters.label: Minimum Brightness (1 – 45 (%))
parameters.description: Set the minimum brightness level (in %) for your dimmer. You won’t be able to dim the light below the set value.

parameters.label: Maximum Brightness (55 – 99 (%))
parameters.description: Set the maximum brightness level (in %) for your dimmer. You won’t be able to add brightness to the light beyond the set value.

parameters.label: Kickstart Brightness Level
parameters.description: Set the kickstart brightness level (in %) for your dimmer. This setting is useful for fixtures that won't turn on when starting from a low brightness level.

parameters.label: Wall Switch Control (Z-Wave inclusion)
parameters.description: Enable or disabled Z-Wave inclusion activation from the wall switch.
parameters.overview:
0 – Inclusion mode from switch disabled

1 – Inclusion mode from switch enabled (default).

parameters.label: Auto Turn-Off Timer
parameters.description: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want the light connected to the dimmer to automatically turn off once it has been turned on. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes or seconds (set the unit in Par. 10).

parameters.label: Auto Turn-On Timer
parameters.description: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want the light connected to the dimmer to automatically turn on once it has been turned off. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes or seconds (set the unit in Par. 10).

parameters.label: Timer Unit
parameters.description: Choose between seconds and minutes as the unit for the timers in parameters 8 and 9

parameters.label: Smart Bulb Mode: Enable/Disable Switch / Z-Wave Control
parameters.description: Enable or disable physical and/or Z-Wave on/off control. If disabled, you’ll only be able to control the connected light via Z-Wave.
parameters.overview:
0 – button and wall switch control disabled, Z-Wave control enabled (the dimmer will still report

on/off control to the hub whenever the button or switch are toggled);

1 – button, wall switch, and Z-Wave control enabled (default);

2 – button, wall switch, and Z-Wave control control disabled (the dimmer will still report on/off control to the hub whenever the button or switch are toggled physically or via Z-Wave).

options.label: button and wall switch control disabled, Z-Wave control enabled (the d
button, wall switch, and Z-Wave control enabled (default)
button, wall switch, and Z-Wave control control disabled (the dimmer w

parameters.label: Wall Switch Control (Type of Wall Switch)
parameters.description: Choose the type of wall switch connected to the 0-10 V dimmer.
parameters.overview:
0 – toggle switch (device changes status when switch changes status);

1 – momentary switch (one-button switch like the ZAC99);

2 – toggle switch with fixed actions (always toggle up for on, always toggle down for off);

3 – 3-way impulse control (for selected 3-way scenarios, refer to the notes in the wiring instructions for your set-up).

Default: 2.

options.label: toggle switch (device changes status when switch changes status)
momentary switch (one-button switch like the ZAC99)
toggle switch with fixed actions (always toggle up for on, always togg
3-way impulse control (for selected 3-way scenarios, refer to the note

parameters.label: Association Reports
parameters.description: Choose the type of reports the relay will send to the hub for Z-Wave and external switch control.
parameters.overview:
0 – switch multilevel reports for Z-Wave control and basic reports for switch control;

1 – switch multilevel reports for both Z-Wave and switch control (default).

options.label: switch multilevel reports for Z-Wave control and basic reports for swi
switch multilevel reports for both Z-Wave and switch control (default)

parameters.label: Dimmer Off Behavior
parameters.description: Choose if you'd like the dimmer to cut power off completely to the 0-10 V driver when in the off position to prevent a glowing effect on the light (applicable to selected 0-10 V fixtures).
parameters.overview:
0 – Keep the power on to the LED driver when the 0-10 V Dimmer is off;

1 – Cut the power off to the LED driver when the 0-10 V Dimmer is off (default).

options.label: Keep the power on to the LED driver when the 0-10 V Dimmer is off
Cut the power off to the LED driver when the 0-10 V Dimmer is off (def

parameters.label: Ramp Rate Control (Physical Ramp Rate On)
parameters.description: Adjust the ramp rate ON for your dimmer when the button paddle is pressed (physical ramp rate on). The Values correspond to the number of seconds required to switch on the dimmer when operated manually.

parameters.label: Ramp Rate Control (Physical Ramp Rate Off)
parameters.description: Adjust the ramp rate OFF for your dimmer when the button paddle is pressed (physical ramp rate off). The Values correspond to the number of seconds required to switch off the dimmer when operated manually.

parameters.label: Ramp Rate Control (Z-Wave Ramp Rate On)
parameters.description: Adjust the ramp rate ON for your dimmer when a Z-Wave command is sent to turn the dimmer on (Z-Wave ramp rate on). The Values correspond to the number of seconds it take for the dimmer to reach full brightness when operated via Z-Wave
parameters.overview:
0 – instant ON

1- 99 seconds

100 – match parameter 15 value (default)

parameters.label: Ramp Rate Control (Z-Wave Ramp Rate Off)
parameters.description: Adjust the ramp rate OFF for your dimmer when a Z-Wave command is sent to turn the dimmer off (Z-Wave ramp rate off). The Values correspond to the number of seconds it take for the dimmer to turn off when operated via Z-Wave.
parameters.overview:
0 – instant OFF

1- 99 seconds 

100 – match parameter 16 value (default)

associations.label: Group 1; Lifeline communication
associations.description: Sends BASIC REPORT and SWITCH BINARY REPORT
associations.overview: Device will send BASIC REPORT and SWITCH BINARY REPORT

associations.label: Group 2
associations.overview: This device will send BASIC SET command.
